author: Nigel Slater
method: Heat a good glug of olive oil in a pan with a few handfuls of mixed tomatoes, cutting up the larger ones roughly. Add a couple of chopped garlic cloves and a quite finely chopped rosemary sprig or two and cook until the tomatoes are squashy. Pour in a bit of double cream at the end, season with salt and freshly ground black pepper and serve on the side of meat, or eat with rice or pasta.
ingredients: glug olive oil,  2-3 handfuls ripe mixed tomatoes,  2 garlic cloves, peeled, chopped,  sprig fresh rosemary, leaves only, finely chopped,  3-4 tbsp double cream,  salt and freshly ground black pepper
